sentences.en: Beware of pickpockets, especially when making a purchase.
sentences.cn: 当心扒手，尤其是在购物的时候。

sentences.en: He gave the pickpocket a good cuff.
sentences.cn: 他给那扒手狠狠一巴掌.

sentences.en: He had his purse stolen by a pickpocket.
He tripped the pickpocket up by the heels.
sentences.cn: 他用脚后跟把扒手绊倒.
他从前是个有名的扒手.

sentences.en: He was robbed of his week's wages by a pickpocket.
sentences.cn: 他一周的薪金被扒手夺去了.

sentences.en: The pickpocket bolted when he saw the policeman.
sentences.cn: 那扒手见了警察便溜之大吉.

sentences.en: The pickpocket pinched her purse and ran away.
sentences.cn: 扒手偷了她的皮夹子跑了.

sentences.en: The pickpocket ran off , hotly pursued by the police.
sentences.cn: 那扒手望风而逃, 警察紧追不舍.

sentences.en: The pickpocket was brought to the nearby police station.
sentences.cn: 小偷被带到附近的派出所.

sentences.en: The pickpocket was caught in the act.
sentences.cn: 这个扒手在行窃时被当场拿住.

sentences.en: The pickpocket was caught in the actual commission of a crime.
sentences.cn: 这扒手是在一次作案时被当场捉住的.

sentences.en: The pickpocket was haled into the police station.
sentences.cn: 扒手被硬拖进警察分局.

sentences.en: The pickpocket was mobbed by angry women.
sentences.cn: 扒手被愤怒的妇女们包围着.

sentences.en: The pickpocket was sent to prison for a year.
sentences.cn: 那个小偷被判处一年监禁.

sentences.en: The policeman recognized her as a pickpocket.

trans.tran_en: someone who steals things from people’s pockets, especially in a crowd
